page.title: 04Stoneyburn Farm.
page.content: Mr Henderson owns about 450 acres. 150 acres of arable land and the rest is hill grazing.He owns cattle and sheep.He has about 400 ewes,50 hogs and the remainder are lambs.In May he usually puts the cattle out to grass but they can't go out yet as the grass is late this year. Mr Henderson usually goes to Lanark Market but sometimes he goes to Biggar or Thornhill. Mr Henderson said that a day on the farm starts at 6:15am.He feeds the cattle,gets tractor work done,then feeds the cattle again at night.He told us that to be a good farmer you need to be a good stockman to tell if any animal is ill and be able to look after the crops.
